tasks.title: Set up the API endpoint for Hello World
tasks.description: Create the GET endpoint `/api/hello` that returns a JSON response.
tasks.details:
1. Set up a new route in the API server for the `/api/hello` endpoint.
2. Implement the handler function to return the JSON response `{'message': 'Hello, World!'}`.
3. Ensure the server is configured to handle JSON responses.
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Use a tool like Postman or cURL to send a GET request to `/api/hello`.
2. Verify that the response is `{'message': 'Hello, World!'}`.
3. Check the HTTP status code to ensure it is 200 OK.

tasks.title: Add unit tests for the Hello World API
tasks.description: Write unit tests to ensure the `/api/hello` endpoint functions correctly.
tasks.details:
1. Set up a testing framework (e.g., Jest, Mocha) if not already configured.
2. Write a test case to send a GET request to `/api/hello`.
3. Assert that the response body is `{'message': 'Hello, World!'}`.
4. Assert that the HTTP status code is 200 OK.
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Run the unit tests using the configured testing framework.
2. Ensure all tests pass without any failures.
3. Verify that the test coverage is adequate and covers all expected scenarios.
